Issues.Title: Custom ShaderEffect does not work in DrawingVisual or background control rendering
Issues.Body:
### Description

I am trying out custom shaders to develop a tool for modifying image brightness and saturation
like this：
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/23449064/4de2d4cb-7c7a-44e6-9668-a2da50c93b44)
You can import an image, modify the slider in the bottom right corner, and then click the save button to save it to a file
>>>
Fortunately, by sliding two sliders in the form, the image has brightness and saturation changes, 
**Unfortunately, The saved image does not have any additional effects**

After various attempts, I have found that the built-in Effect of WPF can operate normally, but the custom ShaderEffect does not work. It seems to have done some different rendering operations on the interface

### Reproduction Steps

1,xaml：
```xml
 <Grid>
        <Grid.RowDefinitions>
            <RowDefinition Height="50" />
            <RowDefinition />
            <RowDefinition Height="50" />
        </Grid.RowDefinitions>
        <Button
            Grid.Row="0"
            Click="Load_Click"
            Content="Load Image" />

        <Image x:Name="image" Grid.Row="1">
            <Image.Effect>
                <shader:IntensitySaturationEffect
                    BaseIntensity="{Binding ElementName=sliderIntensity, Path=Value}"
                    BaseSaturation="1"
                    BloomIntensity="1"
                    BloomSaturation="{Binding ElementName=sliderSaturation, Path=Value}" />
            </Image.Effect>
        </Image>

        <Grid Grid.Row="2">
            <WrapPanel HorizontalAlignment="Left" VerticalAlignment="Center">
                <TextBlock Text="Intensity:" />
                <Slider
                    x:Name="sliderIntensity"
                    Width="100"
                    Maximum="1"
                    Minimum="0"
                    Value="0.5" />
                <TextBlock Text="Saturation:" />
                <Slider
                    x:Name="sliderSaturation"
                    Width="100"
                    Maximum="2"
                    Minimum="0"
                    Value="1" />
            </WrapPanel>
            <Button
                Margin="10,0"
                Padding="10"
                HorizontalAlignment="Right"
                VerticalAlignment="Center"
                Click="Save_Click"
                Content="Save" />
        </Grid>
    </Grid>
```
2,C#
```C#
private void Load_Click(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e) {
            OpenFileDialog openFileDialog = new OpenFileDialog();
            if (openFileDialog.ShowDialog().Value) {
                var bitmapImage = new BitmapImage(new Uri(openFileDialog.FileName));
                image.Source = bitmapImage;
            }
        }

        private void Save_Click(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e) {
            DrawingVisual dv = new DrawingVisual() {
                Effect = image.Effect
            };
            using (DrawingContext dc = dv.RenderOpen()) {
                dc.DrawImage(image.Source, new Rect(0, 0, image.Source.Width, image.Source.Height));
            }
            var renderTargetBitmap = new RenderTargetBitmap((int)image.Source.Width, (int)image.Source.Height, 96, 96, PixelFormats.Pbgra32);
            renderTargetBitmap.Render(dv);

            SaveFileDialog saveFileDialog = new SaveFileDialog();
            if (saveFileDialog.ShowDialog().Value) {
                using (var fileStream = new System.IO.FileStream(saveFileDialog.FileName, System.IO.FileMode.Create)) {
                    var encoder = new PngBitmapEncoder();
                    encoder.Frames.Add(BitmapFrame.Create(renderTargetBitmap));
                    encoder.Save(fileStream);
                }
            }
        }
```
3.Comparing UI and Files(The left side shows the saved results, and the right side shows the UI display)
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/23449064/fad0dcbe-869d-44b0-b21c-301f5edeb47b)


### Expected behavior

UI and file consistency

### Actual behavior

UI and file inconsistency

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

No solution
The methods I have tried:
Using the DropShadowEffect that comes with WPF    √

But WPF does not have its own saturation brightness effect......

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

I have uploaded the code to github：https://github.com/BigHeadDev/CustomShaderEffectTest

Issues.Title: A11y_.NET Core_WPF_DatabindingDemo_ListofProducts_Add product listing_Resize: In 200% zoom, the content under "Item for sale" are getting truncated.
Issues.Body:
### Description


“[Check out Accessibility Insights!](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

### GitHubTags:
#A11yMAS;#A11yTCS;#BM_.NET Core[WPF]_Win32_May23;#.NET Core;#A11ySev2;#WCAG1.4.4;#DesktopApp;#Win11;#Zoom;#Benchmark;

### Environment Details:
Application Name: .NET Core
WPF
Operating System: Windows 11 Enterprise 21H2

### Reproduction Steps

1. Launch VS 2022 Preview
2. TAB to Sample Applications and right-click on the "DatabindingDemo" and click on build.
3. Then right click on "DatabindingDemo" then Click on Debug-->Start New Instance.
4. "List of products" screen should open.
5. TAB to "Add product" button and click on it.
6. Zoom the screen to 200% and observe that the content under "Item for sale" are getting truncated in 200% zoom.

### Expected behavior

In 200% zoom, the content under "Item for sale" should not getting truncated. All the contents should completely visible.

### Actual behavior

In 200% zoom, the content under "Item for sale" are getting truncated. The texts are not completely visible.

![A11y_ NET Core_WPF_DatabindingDemo_ListofProducts_Add product listing_Resize](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/91525824/3a776239-0ffc-4d2a-ade7-e4bbd96d7a89)


### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

Users with low vision who zoom the page for better visibility will face difficulty if the content of "Item for sale" are getting truncated.

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

_No response_

Issues.Title: View used AllowsTransparency And DropShadowEffect Causing UI Stuck
Issues.Body:
There is a WPF program using CM Framework 3.2. I have a replay.xaml page that displays two images and two timestamp texts every 30ms to play back videos in a modal manner.
When using the AllowsTransparency and DropShadowEffect properties on the page, opening multiple replay.xaml pages can cause the UI to refresh slowly and become sluggish.
After I delete the relevant code of AllowsTransparency and DropShadowEffect only in replay.xaml, opening multiple replay.xaml pages will not cause the UI to become sluggish.
My display settings in the code are:
AllowsTransparency = True;
Grid.Effect>
DropShadowEffect ShadowDepth="0"
BlurRadius="5"
Opacity="0.9" />
Grid.Effect>
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "View used AllowsTransparency And DropShadowEffect Causing UI Stuck" (#7857)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NET Core_WPF_ExpenseItIntro_ExpenseReportfor_Keyboard: The table column headers are not accessible by keyboard.
Issues.Body:
### Description

“[Check out Accessibility Insights!](https://accessibilityinsights.io/) - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

### GitHubTags: 
#A11yMAS;#A11yTCS;#BM_.NET Core[WPF]_Win32_May23;#.NET Core;#A11ySev2;#WCAG2.1.1;#DesktopApp;#Win11;#Keyboard;#Benchmark;

### Environment Details:
Application Name: .NET Core
 WPF
Operating System: Windows 11 Enterprise 21H2

### Reproduction Steps:
1. Launch VS 2022 Preview
2. TAB to Getting started and right click on the Expense it intro and click on build
3. Then right click on Expense it Intro then Click on Debug-->Start New Instance.
4. Navigate to Names list and select any name and click on View.
5. 'Expense Report for' screen will open
6. Tab till table and observe the issue.

### Expected behavior

The table column headers "ExpenseType" and "Amount" should be accessible by keyboard. So that the sorting functionality should be accessible by using keyboard.

### Actual behavior

The table column headers "ExpenseType" and "Amount" are not accessible by keyboard. While using mouse and clicking on this column headers sorting functionality is performed but we are not able to use sorting functionality by using keyboard
![A11y_ NET Core_WPF_ExpenseItIntro_ExpenseReportfor_Keyboard](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/91525824/f8b7397b-4a64-427b-927d-1169f373a9c2)


### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

Keyboard users will not be able to sort the data by using keyboard if we are not able to use sorting functionality by using keyboard.

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

_No response_

Issues.Title: Removing xamltypemapper clearance from finally in compile function
Issues.Body:
Fixes #7439

## Description

Removing call to XamlTyperMapper.Clear() function from finally block in compile function as the static members `HasInternal` is refrenced at the later part of codeflow and it is unsafe to clear the static members at this point of time. That being said, XamlTypeMapper gets clear in the next iteration of call to compile function.

## Customer Impact

Application having user control with internal constructors will crash.

## Regression

NA

## Testing

In-progress

## Risk

Assessing

Issues.Title: In a RichTextBox within WPF, it seems that PreviewKeyDown cannot effectively block all events.
Issues.Body:
### Description

I'm developing a page similar to a terminal using RichTextBox, so I want to control user input. I registered the PreviewKeyDown event, which theoretically should be able to block all events. However, when I select a portion of text and then press any key, the selected text gets deleted. It seems that this triggers a precondition for replacing text in the session. The code looks something like this:

ConsoleRichTextBox.PreviewKeyDown += OnPreviewKeyDown; void OnPreviewKeyDown(object sender, KeyEventArgs e) { e.Handled = true; }



I tried popping the stack in the TextChanged event (which gets triggered first in this case), and I got the following stack:



在 TranslateStudio.Views.Pages.UnityTranslate.UnityConsolePage.OnTextChanged(Object sender, TextChangedEventArgs e) 在 E:\GitLibrary\JustTranslate\ChatGptServer\TranslateStudio\Views\Pages\UnityTranslate\UnityConsolePage.xaml.cs 中: 第 114 行

在 System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeHandler(Delegate handler, Object target)

在 System.Windows.EventRoute.InvokeHandlersImpl(Object source, RoutedEventArgs args, Boolean reRaised)

在 System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEventImpl(DependencyObject sender, RoutedEventArgs args)

在 System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.TextBoxBase.OnTextContainerChanged(Object sender, TextContainerChangedEventArgs e)

在 System.Windows.Documents.TextContainer.EndChange(Boolean skipEvents)

在 System.Windows.Documents.TextRangeBase.EndChange(ITextRange thisRange, Boolean disableScroll, Boolean skipEvents)

在 System.Windows.Documents.TextSelection.System.Windows.Documents.ITextRange.set_Text(String value)

在 System.Windows.Documents.TextEditor.SetText(ITextRange range, String text, CultureInfo cultureInfo)

在 System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeHandler(Delegate handler, Object target)

在 System.Windows.EventRoute.InvokeHandlersImpl(Object source, RoutedEventArgs args, Boolean reRaised)

在 System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEventImpl(DependencyObject sender, RoutedEventArgs args)

在 System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseTrustedEvent(RoutedEventArgs args)

在 System.Windows.Input.InputManager.ProcessStagingArea()

在 System.Windows.Input.InputProviderSite.ReportInput(InputReport inputReport)

在 System.Windows.Interop.HwndKeyboardInputProvider.ProcessKeyAction(MSG& msg, Boolean& handled)

在 System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.CriticalTranslateAccelerator(MSG& msg, ModifierKeys modifiers)

在 System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.OnPreprocessMessage(Object param)

在 System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)

在 System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)



How can I prevent the Session from replacing the text?

### Reproduction Steps

RichTextBox.PreviewKeyDown += OnPreviewKeyDown; 

void OnPreviewKeyDown(object sender, KeyEventArgs e) { e.Handled = true; }

//You can reproduce this issue on any page.

### Expected behavior

PreviewKeyDown should be able to block any text manipulation actions.

### Actual behavior

PreviewKeyDown cannot effectively block all events.

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

Currently, it seems that modifying the events registered by TextEditor can only be achieved through reflection.

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

_No response_

Issues.Title: Cannot retrieve value using the binding and no valid fallback value exists- Binding error occur when we define the listbox itemtemplate in code behind.
Issues.Body: ### Description We have facing the below error while run the attached sample . **Binding Error:** Cannot retrieve value using the binding and no valid fallback value exists; using default instead. BindingExpression:Path=DataContext.ForeGroundBrush; DataItem=null; target element is 'ToggleButton' (Name='toggleButtonItem'); target property is 'Background' (type 'Brush') **Explanation:** In the sample, we have created a style for a toggle button and updated its background property by binding it to the ViewModel property.This style is then bound to the corresponding control located in the DataTemplate. The DataTemplate is assigned as an ItemTemplate of the ListBox, and this process is done in the Loaded event of the Grid. Please refer to the screenshots below. **We need to understand why this binding error occurs and how to avoid and resolve it.** **Sample :** [WPFDemo.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/11505891/WPFDemo.zip) ### Reproduction Steps 1. Run the attached sample. 2. And see the output window. 3. Then lot of binding error will be shown. And we need a information for why the above reported binding error occurs. **Note:** These binding errors are only shown when you enable the settings below in Visual Studio. Tools → Options → Debugging → OutputWindow → WPFTraceSettings → DataBinding → All. ### Expected behavior Binding error should not shown. ### Actual behavior Lot of binding error shown with the above reported error. ### Regression? _No response_ ### Known Workarounds _No response_ ### Impact _No response_ ### Configuration Which version of .NET is the code running on? - 4.6 What OS and version, and what distro if applicable? - Windows 11 What is the architecture (x64, x86, ARM, ARM64)? - No need Do you know whether it is specific to that configuration? - No ### Other information _No response_
